intro: Pristimera caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed pristimera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
